TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IControlDesignerBehavior

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The recommended alternative is System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag and System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.summary: Enables the extension of specific behaviors of a control designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerBehavior> interface is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView> interfaces for equivalent control designer functionality.

Docs.summary: Gets the design-time view control object for the designer.
Docs.value: The view control object for the designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerBehavior> interface is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView> interfaces for equivalent control designer functionality.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ DesignTimeHtml { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.DesignTimeHtml : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the design-time HTML for the designer's control.
Docs.value: The HTML used at design time to format the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerBehavior> interface is obsolete. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView> interfaces for equivalent control designer functionality.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnTemplateModeChanged() cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides an opportunity to perform processing when the designer enters or exits template mode.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerBehavior.OnTemplateModeChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

block.para:
The interface is obsolete. Use the and interfaces for equivalent control designer functionality.
When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method so that registered delegates receive the event.
